qas.question: How are Digital-RGB LED strobe signals connected?
What object sources the data in of the first LED of a digital rgb LED?
The microprocessor does what in a digital RGB LED?

answers.text: control the brightness and color of each LED independently of the others

qas.question: What is one example of where Digital RGB LED lights are used?
What makes RGB LEDs the same?
How are non-Digital-RGB LED strobe signals connected?
What object sources the data in of the first non-LED of a digital rgb LED?
The non-microprocessor does what in a digital RGB LED?
What is one example of where non-Digital RGB LED lights are used?

context: Digital-RGB LEDs are RGB LEDs that <a0_0>contain <b5_0>their own "smart" control electronics<b5_0/><a0_0/>. In addition to power and ground, these provide connections for data-in, data-out, and sometimes a clock or strobe signal. These are connected <a1_0>in a <b6_0>daisy chain<b6_0/><a1_0/>, with the data in of the first LED sourced by a <a2_0><b7_0>microprocessor<b7_0/><a2_0/>, which can <a3_0><b8_0>control the brightness and color<b8_0/> of each LED independently of the others<a3_0/>. They are used where a combination of maximum control and minimum visible electronics are needed such as strings for <a4_0><b9_0>Christmas<b9_0/><a4_0/> and LED matrices. Some even have refresh rates in the kHz range, allowing for basic video applications.
